sentences.en: A clown's job is to amuse the spectators.
sentences.cn: 小丑的工作就是娱乐观众.

sentences.en: All my attempts to amuse the children were met with sullen scowls.
sentences.cn: 我想尽办法哄这些孩子玩儿,但是他们总是满脸不高兴.

sentences.en: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.cn: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

sentences.en: He could amuse us for hours with his stories of the theater.
sentences.cn: 他能接连几小时地为我们讲戏剧故事逗我们发笑.

sentences.en: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.cn: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.en: How do you amuse yourself in rainy weather?
I amuse myself with ( by ) reading.
I often amuse myself with reading.
It's too wet for the children to play out today; they'll have to amuse themselves indoors.
sentences.cn: 今天外面太潮,孩子们不宜在户外玩耍, 他们得在室内玩了.

sentences.en: Put a selection of baby toys in his cot to amuse him if he wakes early.
sentences.cn: 要在婴儿床里放一些玩具，以便他醒得早时可以自己玩。
有些人以干荒唐事取乐.

sentences.en: The actor is really ham it up to amuse the audience.
sentences.cn: 这些演员为博观众一粲,表演得实在太过火了.

sentences.en: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
The question seemed to amuse him in some way.
sentences.cn: 这个问题似乎不知怎么把他给逗乐了。

sentences.en: The thought seemed to amuse him.
sentences.cn: 这种想法好像把他逗乐了。

sentences.en: Their antics never fail to amuse.
sentences.cn: 他们滑稽的举止总是让人发笑。

sentences.en: They sang songs to amuse themselves during the break.
sentences.cn: 休息时,大家一起唱唱歌,娱乐娱乐.

sentences.en: Tom makes up stories to amuse his little brother.
sentences.cn: 汤姆编故事逗他的小弟弟.

words.tran_cn: 愉快的，顽皮的；被逗乐的
有趣的，好玩的；引人发笑的
逗笑（amuse的过去分词）；使欢乐
逗乐；打发；使…高兴（amuse的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: to make time pass in an enjoyable way, so that you do not get bored

trans.tran_cn: 逗乐， 使…开心； 给…提供娱乐
trans.tran_en: to make someone laugh or smile
